item.description: HEY MURADIN PUT A BIRD ON IT Like we said last week‚Ä¶Warrior glyphs in Mists = THE COOLEST. Some news about the next few weeks! This weekend, we‚Äôll be attending a Comic Expo in Calgary! Excitement! Our strip next week will be something based off the Expo, we hope. Then, the week after that we plan on presenting the special guest strip for Great Blog Noblegarden Egg Hunt! So keep your eyes peeled!

item.title: The Art of War, Part One
item.description: A Glyph that causes a lightning strike? ‚Ä¶I have a sudden urge to play a warrior in Mists. Seriously though, it‚Äôs terrific that Blizzard is giving us all these new fun cosmetic glyphs. They‚Äôre little touches, but damn are they cool. My personal favorite so far? That would be Glyph of the Geist. BECAUSE GEISTS ARE AWESOME. (In other news, I think Vid is going to revolt if I make her draw Garrosh again.

item.title: For This Moment Alone
item.description: It‚Äôs a good thing hitting the button on LFR Ultraxion isn‚Äôt necessary to beat the fight, because if it was, I don‚Äôt think a single LFR group would ever kill him. Like, seriously, it‚Äôs NOT THAT HARD, PEOPLE. PUSH THE DAMN BUTTON. IT‚ÄôS RIGHT THERE IN THE MIDDLE OF YOUR SCREEN, FOR CRYING OUT LOUD. But no. It‚Äôs enough to make a healer tear their hair out in frustration. In other news, here is a snippet of the From Draenor creative process at work:

item.title: The Legacy of Kip Diskin
item.description: The new glyphs on the Mists of Pandaria beta sound amazing. Trust me, this is not the only glyph feature you‚Äôll be seeing on From Draenor. I was actually surprised to see an Orca glyph, since they seem more suitable for Northrend than the lush, temperate zones of Pandaria. Wouldn‚Äôt it be funny if there were a huge assortment of minor glyphs that changed the appearance of druid travel and aquatic forms?

item.title: Not Who We Expected
item.description: As everyone knows by now, Garrosh Hellscream will be the boss of Mists of Pandaria‚Äôs final content patch, and we take him down in an exciting-sounding ‚ÄúSiege of Orgrimmar.‚Äù Now, there‚Äôs a lot of time between now and then, but I have to say‚Ä¶given what we‚Äôve seen of Sylvanas in Cataclysm ‚Äì being quite dastardly towards the Worgen during their starting zone, raising unwilling humans into new Forsaken and conscripting them into her forces, and her cold and callous treatment towards Koltira ‚Äì I really expected her to be the Horde leader we‚Äôd end up killing as a raid boss.

item.title: Our Unsung Hero
item.description: From Draenor presents, Real Azerothian Geniuses. Today we salute you, Mr. Lamp Hum Sound Creator Guy. You work tirelessly to capture the tranquil sound of a summer breeze or the frantic buzz of fireflies trapped in a jar, just to make our weary trek through the wild a little less scary. In the darkest of nights, we pause on our journey, wondering if that subtle rustling we just heard was one of your masterpieces singing its peaceful song of illumination, or a horrible flesh-eating zombie lurking in the bushes.

item.title: Resurrection Sickness
item.description: Everyone‚Äôs been buzzing about the new & improved Scroll of Resurrection, and why not? A free level 80, realm transfer AND faction transfer? Just for coming back to the game? Yeah, it‚Äôs no wonder the new Scroll offer has been so popular. Of course, we all know what‚Äôs REALLY behind the Scroll frenzy. SPECTRAL MOUNTS. Awww yeah. That‚Äôs the kind of incentive that gets RESULTS. PS: Did you know Stormwind really does have a War Room?

item.title: Darkmoon Foul
item.description: Seriously, does no one else at the Faire raise an eyebrow at the fact that each month, Kerri Hicks is collecting thousands of bloody ears? I mean, the icon is an ear, and Blizzard has a tendency to encourage ear-collecting, ever since Diablo. What the heck is she DOING with all of these bloody trophies?? It seems such a disproportionate reward, too ‚Äì you bring back proof of 250(!) kills and you get 10 little tickets.

item.title: To the Ground
item.description: The idea of class abilities repeating endlessly was actually really hard to make a comic for, because there were so many awesome options! The mental images of Healing Rain, Hurricane or Fan of Knives duplicating over and over again are too funny. In the end, we decided to go with a theme preferred by Vid: CAKES (you can never have too much cake, according to her) and dead Warlocks. Also, the opportunity to have a sea of cakes was too great to pass up.

item.title: Every Day I‚Äôm Transmogging
item.description: This may be my favourite FDWL in the history of ever. (I know, we‚Äôve only done less than 20 strips but even so!) Usually the way we make strips is one of us has an idea and pitches it to the other, then we start to brain-storm and perhaps refine or change a few things. Sometimes the strip is fully formed, as when Rades presented this one to me like so:

item.title: Your Racial Leader is Thinking About You
item.description: It occurred to Vid and I yesterday that perhaps we should have saved the comic with the NAKED ORC for our Valentine‚Äôs Day update. Apparently we are unable to read calendars. We figured we needed to do SOMETHING love-themed for this week ‚Äì after all, the comic IS From Draenor With LOVE! Well, who better to feature on our special Valentine‚Äôs Day card than another local from Draenor, the Warchief himself!

item.title: Maximum Cupacity
item.description: I really, really wish we had ampm stores in Canada. I would totally buy those cups! The art on them looks great, and they‚Äôd be nice collectibles to own. The three ‚Äúrejected‚Äù cup ideas we came up with for this strip should all be sadly familiar to most WoW players. I don‚Äôt think anyone will EVER forget Sindragosa‚Äôs famous line, and Neptulon‚Äôs PUUUURE WATERRRR line from Throne of the Tides has quickly become a fan favorite.

item.title: Squeaky Green
item.description: When we heard that there would be no Blizzcon this year, Vid and I knew we had to cover it somehow. We ran down the list of Blizzcon cliches (true or not), one of which was the inevitable pungent result of cramming hundreds of bodies into a cramped, enclosed convention center. Then, somehow, it became this. To say Vid was mortified when I sent her the script would be an understatement.

item.title: Choose Wisely
item.description: Yes, we know Droids and Hutts are not actually available player races in SWTOR. Too bad ‚Äì I would totally be a Hutt so I could use awful HUTT YOUR MOUTH and HUTT UP puns and make everyone hate me. Also, I wish I could say we were joking when talking about Vid‚Äôs overpowering love for anyone blue. Let‚Äôs just say that panel 4 isn‚Äôt entirely off the mark. üòâ

item.title: Magic Touch
item.description: ‚Ä¶Then I finally found a suitable mold for the chassis or I thought it was a suitable chassis mold but actually they meant it for a gyrocopter and it wasn‚Äôt quite right so I tried to convince a friend to model for it but he wouldn‚Äôt because he said, and I quote, ‚ÄúYour inventions have a way of proving fatal to people who agree to test them,‚Äù I ask you, is that fair?

item.title: Thrall, Aspect of Derp
item.description: In the final fight of Dragon Soul, players have to fight Deathwing while leaping back and forth between a few different islands, carried by Thrall‚Äôs winds. Unfortunately, Thrall has some‚Ä¶issues‚Ä¶and will occasionally NOT give a player the wind buff, which sends them plummeting to their death in the churning Maelstrom below. This usually results in much anger and frustration, and usually a wipe. Is he just trolling us? Or is he just really, really incompetent?

item.title: Damn You, Murglesnout
item.description: Oh, Murglesnout. Fisher‚Äôs bane. So plentiful. So abundant. So utterly, completely worthless. True, Blizzard did eventually add in a Cooking recipe so that the dreaded Murglesnout wasn‚Äôt COMPLETELY pointless. But it‚Äôs TOO LATE! Even now, the mere sight of THIS TERRIBLE FISH fills me with rage. MURGLESNOUT! ‚Ä¶however, it really does make a fun ‚Äúgift‚Äù to give friends. If you want to MAKE THEM ANGRY! MURGLESNOUT!

item.title: Winter Fail Part Four
item.description: I wasn‚Äôt actually sure how Rades intended to end our little odyssey. Needless to say, my jaw dropped when I got this far in the script. It‚Äôs great for him, though, because he gets to show his mad genius! Vid, who has no compunction about blasting a rocket straight into Ironforge or any other environs, is a little uneasy when it comes to FrankenWinter. But ultimately, she decides that it‚Äôs better to let a cyborg version of Greatfather Winter do all of the Winter‚Äôs Veil stuff ‚Äì so that she and Rades don‚Äôt have to.

item.title: Winter Fail Part Three
item.description: Part 3 of 4! Rades and Vid do their best to fill the late Greatfather Winter‚Äôs shoes ‚Äì in their own, unique fashion, of course. Locations where Vid is now no longer permitted to operate: The Exodar AND Ironforge. Hey, isn‚Äôt that rocket in panel 4 the same type as the one that blew up Greatfather Winter? Oh well, what those Druids don‚Äôt know, won‚Äôt hurt them‚Ä¶hopefully. Next week‚Äôs Part 4 will come out a few days after Christmas, so consider it our special (belated) gift to you for reading!

item.title: Winter Fail Part Two
item.description: The saga continues! Oh no, poor Greatfather Winter! Vid did an awesome job with the expressions in this strip, I think you‚Äôll all agree. I‚Äôm now using the ‚ÄúSad Rades‚Äù face as my avatar, and I can‚Äôt even look at panel 3 without laughing. There was some debate about which Greatfather Winter to use ‚Äì the dwarven Alliance version, or the orcish Horde version! In the end though, we decided to go with the dwarf, to include more races.

item.title: Winter Fail Part One
item.description: It‚Äôs a cliche often used that ‚Äúthe journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.‚Äù In this case, a journey of approximately 17,500 miles per hour begins with a single rocket and a large explosion. This is how engineers work. Rades and I wanted to do something a little special and different for the upcoming holiday season, as well as try our hands at a mini story-arc! So expect this story to run for pretty much the rest of the month, until we reach its epic conclusion.

item.title: Transmogalypse
item.description: Has there ever been a feature more eagerly anticipated than Transmogrification? If there is, I sure haven‚Äôt seen it. So many options! So much potential for nostalgia! The future has arrived, and its name is World of Dresscraft. Of course, for every person who can‚Äôt wait to dig out their old Tier 1 or Tier 0.5 sets, there‚Äôs someone who is going to gleefully turn their fearsome, godly ‚ÄúI‚Äôm-About-to-Kill-Deathwing‚Äù armor into a neon nightmare Burning Crusade clown suit.

item.title: For Science, You Monster
item.description: Hey guys, Vid‚Äôs been crit by real life this week, so send her warm thoughts because until she‚Äôs back, you‚Äôre stuck with my terrible WoW Model Viewer comics! Last night Blizzard released an updated Mists of Pandaria talent calculator, complete with new baseline talents. One of the new baseline Warlock talents was Demonic Portal, as pictured above. Needless to say, the Portal comparisons were instant and furious! So I figured it was an appropriate time to break out ye old Undercity Companion Cube image from this year‚Äôs Love is in the Air seasonal event.

item.title: Yellow Angry Man
item.description: If you‚Äôve played a paladin at level 85 for any length of time, hopefully this requires no explanation. For those of you who haven‚Äôt, well. Perhaps you play a melee DPS. You‚Äôre at the boss‚Äô feet, stabbing/slicing/cutting (or whatever else it is that you melee folks do). You hear an odd grunt. ‚ÄúARRRRGH!‚Äù ‚ÄúGRRRRRR!‚Äù ‚ÄúRRRRRAAA!‚Äù This, my friends, is the Yellow, Angry Man. His anger knows no bounds. Likewise, his yellow-ness is unsurpassed.

item.title: Grudge Match
item.description: When the Pet Battle System was announced at Blizzcon, everyone had a wide range of reactions. Were they serious? Was this an elaborate joke? How much more like Pokemon could this possibly be? But without question, the most important possibility was the potential hilarity of absurd pet matchups, such as Alliance Balloon vs. Horde Balloon, or Enchanted Broom vs. Magic Lamp. Can you say EXCITEMENT?? Personally, I‚Äôm banking on my Toxic Wasteling.

item.title: Rare Spawn
item.description: I‚Äôm not especially good at keeping secrets. So the fact that you are only seeing this, now, after over a month of loving work is nothing short of a miracle. The idea of doing a webcomic wasn‚Äôt a new one for Rades and I ‚Äì we‚Äôd talked about it before, sometime last year ‚Äì but the time wasn‚Äôt right. We were on different pages about what a comic should be (I was thinking epic story, he was thinking gag) and so we just shelved it.

item.title: About
item.description: Stacey is the author of Manalicious, a World of Warcraft blog about mages, guild leading, and heroic internet dragons. She is a freelance artist/illustrator who likes digital painting, making tiny Sculpey figurines, and drawing with Staedtler pigment liners (0.5, thanks!) She also enjoys writing, reading a wide variety of books, video games, and baking things for other people to eat. She lives with her husband Vosskah and a large silly chocolate Labrador Retriever named Rufus.

item.title: Characters
item.description: Rades Class: Hunter Affiliation: Horde Race: Orc Left Horde army after attack on Theramore. Engineer. Adores beasts. Unlucky. Vidyala Class: Paladin Affiliation: Alliance Race: Draenei Battle healer. Military upbringing. Engineer. Doesn’t mind a good brawl. Wrathion Class: Black Prince Affiliation: Blacktalon Race: Black Dragon Only untainted member of the Black Dragonflight. Confident. Personal crusade to kill all other black dragons.
